children.subject:
Did you see @248? The posted solution was incorrect - the base case should include $$T(i,0)=0$$ $$\forall i$$ instead of just $$T(0,0)=0$$ and (arguably), $$T(0,b)=\infty$$ $$\forall b > 0$$ instead of "initialize whole table to infinity" (although the latter clearly accomplishes the same thing, it's just not needed).

If you were docked points for having those base cases, you can rest easy that this was a mistake.
You can put a Gradescope regrade request and the appropriate TA will respond.  --Eric

I dont really care about a regrade in terms of the score, I am already at 1.25/1 points so asking a TA to regrade seems frivolous, but I am interested in why my base-case is considered incorrect. Comparing to the t-square solution, it looks fine to me. In this and in similar situations is my best course of action to request a regrade or to make a post on piazza or something else?

history.content:
We list all rubric items for each problems so that you can see what mistakes other students are making. You grade comes from the highlighted ones, so don't panic when you see all rubric items.

If you are looking for a regrade, we strongly recommend you read the solution provided on T-sq and compare with your answers and the comments first. Most of regrade requests can be avoided if these two things are done.

If you do feel that you have something need to be regraded, you can use the regrade function provided by Gradescope, and we will receive a message for regrading. Please let us know if you have further questions. Thanks!

-----------------------------------------------------

update:

Only the applied rubric is shown now. Apologize for the confusion.
